ab.title: Leviticus 9
ab.l: And it wason the eighth day, Moses called Aaronand his sons and the elders of Israel.
And he said to Aaron, ‘Take you a young calf of cattlefor a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering, unblemished, and bring them forwardbefore the Lord.
And you shall speak to the children of Israel,saying, “Take you a kid of the goats for a sin offering and a calf and a lamb,unblemished one-year-olds, for a burnt offering,
And a bull and a ram for peace offeringsto sacrifice before the Lord, and a grain offering mixed with oil,because today the divine Presence of the Lord will appear to you.”’
And they brought that which Moses commanded before the tent of meeting,and all the congregation drew near and stood before the Lord.
And Moses said, ‘This is the word which the Lord commandedthat you should do, and the divine Presence of the Lord will appear to you.’

And Moses said to Aaron, ‘Come forward to the altar, and makeyour sin offering and your burnt offering, and ask for atonement for yourselfand for the people, and make the offering of the people,and ask for atonement for them, as the Lord commanded.’
And Aaron came forward to the altar and slaughtered the calfof the sin offering that he had.
Andthe sons of Aaron brought forward the blood to him, and he dipped his fingerin the blood and put it on the horns of the altar andpoured out the blood at the base of the altar.
And he burned the fat and the kidneys and theextra |fat| from the liver of the sin offering on the altar,as the Lord commanded Moses.
Andhe burned the flesh and the skin in fire outsidethe camp.
And he slaughtered the burnt offering,and Aaron’s sons gave him promptly the blood, and he sprinkledit on the altar all around.
Andthey gave him promptly the burned offering according to its pieces and the head,and he burned them on the altar.
Andhe washed the entrails and the knees, and he burnedthe burnt offering on the altar.
And he brought forward thepeople’s offering and took the kid of the sin offering thatwas for the people and slaughtered it, and he made a sin offering like the first.
And he brought forward the burnt offering and made itaccording to the |required| manner.
And he brought forward the grainoffering and filled his hand from it and burned it on the altar –besides the morning’s burnt offering.
Andhe slaughtered the bull and the ram fora sacrifice of peace offerings that was for the people. And Aaron’s sonsgave him promptly the blood, and he sprinkled it on the altarall around,
And the fat from the bulland from the ram, the |fat| tail, and the fat which coversthe stomach, and the kidneys, and the extra|fat| of the liver.
And they put the faton the breasts, and he burned the fat on the altar.
And Aaron elevated the breasts and the right thighfor a wave offering before the Lord, as Moses commanded.
And Aaron raised his handstoward the people and blessed them after hehad come down from making the sin offering and the burnt offering and the peace offerings.

And Moses and Aaron came to the tent of meetingto pray before God to make the fire come down from heavensto consume the offerings that were on the altar. And when theycame out, they blessed the people, andthe divine Presence of the Lord appeared to all the people.
And fire came out from before the Lord and consumedthe burnt offering and the fat on the altar,and the people saw, they sang praisesand fell on their faces.
